p: The Barents Sea deserves specific mention because it is mostly located within this cluster’s range of latitudes, but it is characterized by sea-ice conditions more similar to that of the first cluster ( Fig. 4, 61°N). In the Barents Sea, we expect an increase in GPP similar to that seen at the lowest latitudes ( Fig. 3A) because of significant sea ice and snow thinning ( Fig. 4, 61°N). However, we expect this to be modulated by the sharper photoperiod typical of these latitudes. This might reduce the length of the ice algal growing season in a way that is similar to the second cluster ( Fig. 4, 71°N).
